Event.0: Actress Andie MacDowell (46) divorces businessman Rhett Hartzog (45) after nearly three years of marriage
Event.1: Triggered by the September 11 attacks, the Afghanistan War began, as U.S. and British warplanes started bombing Taliban targets.
Event.2: The U.S. invasion of Afghanistan starts with an air assault and covert operations on the ground
Event.3: Last ever competitive soccer match at Wembley Stadium, England defeated 1-0 by Germany, last goal scored by Liverpool's Dietmar Hammann. Match is Tony Adams' 60th at Wembley, the record for most appearances at the stadium.
Event.4: Fox News Channel, a satellite and cable news network created by Roger Ailes for Rupert Murdoch's News Corporation, was launched in the United States.
Event.5: Robin Givens files for divorce after 8-month marriage to Mike Tyson
Event.6: Members of the Palestine Liberation Front, a small faction headed by Abu Abbas within the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), hijacked an Italian cruise ship, the Achille Lauro.
Event.7: Musical "Cats" opens at Winter Garden Theater on Broadway NYC and runs for nearly 18 years before closing on September 10, 2000.
Event.8: "The French Connection" directed by William Friedkin and starring Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider and Fernando Rey premieres in the US (Academy Awards Best Picture 1972)
Event.9: Actress and comedian Phyllis Diller (48) weds actor Warde Donovan
Event.10:
Simon Cowell
British television producer
was born
Event.11:
Yo-Yo Ma
American cellist
was born
Event.12: Cellist Yo-Yo Ma, who was known for his extraordinary technique and rich tone, was born in Paris.
Event.13:
Vladimir Putin
president of Russia
was born
Event.14: Russian politician Vladimir Putin, who served as president and prime minister of Russia, was born.
Event.15:
German Democratic Republic proclaimed
On this day in 1949, a constitution went into effect in the Soviet occupation zone of Germany that formed the country of East Germany, which existed alongside West Germany until 1990, when the two Germanys reunited.
Event.16: The Dumbarton Oaks Conference, in which the United States, China, the Soviet Union, and the United Kingdom formulated proposals for a world organization that became the basis for the United Nations, concluded in Washington, D.C.
Event.17: Playwright, poet, novelist, and essayist Amiri Baraka, who wrote of the experiences and anger of African Americans, was born.
Event.18: KLM, Royal Dutch Airlines, established (oldest existing airline)
Event.19: 44th US Ambassador to the United Kingdom Joseph P. Kennedy, Sr. (26) weds John F. Fitzgerald's daughter, Rose Fitzgerald (24)
Event.20:
Heinrich Himmler
German Nazi leader
was born
Event.21:
Niels Bohr
Danish physicist
was born
Event.22: American short-story writer, poet, and critic Edgar Allan Poe died in Baltimore, Maryland.
Event.23: The Granite Railway, the first chartered railroad in the United States, began service.
Event.24: American forces defeated British loyalists at the Battle of Kings Mountain during the American Revolution.
Event.25: Crown Prince Paul of Russia marries Sophie Marie Dorothea of Württemberg.
Event.26: The Stamp Act Congress convened in New York City to frame resolutions of “rights and grievances” of the American colonies.
Event.27: George III of Great Britain issues Proclamation of 1763, closing lands in North America north and west of Alleghenies to white settlement
Event.28: A cyclone causes 40 foot waves that are believed to have killed 300,000 in Calcutta, India
Event.29: Allied Christian forces defeated the Ottoman Turks during a naval engagement at the Battle of Lepanto.
Event.30: Battle of Lepanto: Holy League of southern European nations destroy Ottoman fleet in significant loss off Western Greece
